publisher.publisher-name: University of Hawaiʻi Press for the Biographical Research Center

title-group.article-title: BIOGRAPHY AND THE POLITICAL UNCONSCIOUS: ELLISON, TOOMER, JAMESON, AND THE POLITICS OF SYMPTOMATIC READING

abstract.p: As demonstrated by the workings of the political unconscious in Jean Toomer's Cane and Ralph Ellison's Invisible Man, investigation of authorial biography is an indispensable component of Marxist literary criticism. Symptomatic reading, while derogated by the advocates of "surface reading," remains crucial to textual interpretation.
